description: Make sure this works then publish it !

Before the Coq Platform was available as a Snap package, I had to manually install opam and spend time and computing resources to build and install coqc from scratch, and similarly for CoqIDE. Furthermore, manually resolving the dependencies for CoqIDE was time-consuming and error-prone, and I had to manually build and install every external Coq library (e.g. VST) that I wanted to use in my projects.

Now, with the Snap package, all this is done for me with a single click and I don't have to waste CPU cycles building the software since the binaries are included directly within the Snap package. Another advantage is that the platform comes with commonly used third-party libraries by default so I don't have to add them myself.

As of 31/05/2021, the CoqIDE desktop entry fails to launch CoqIDE, saying that the Exec field is missing, but I can launch it directly from the command line so it isn't a major issue. Overall, I consider this package to be a 9/10 and would definitely recommend to newcomers to Coq over the manual installation method with opam.
Have to run it from the command line -coqide-.

Un film moyen, dispensable. Les acteurs ne sont pas charismatiques, l'intrigue est du déjà vu, et la fin décevante. Georges P. Dommage, il y avait un bon scenario mais l'histoire est plombée par un rythme mollasson.
